Posts.Content: Hi Leonaw 123 I was diagnosed with breast cancer on 18th December just gone. I had to wait 11 days for biopsy results which does seem like a lifetime and it's 11 days of self torture of not knowing how bad the cancer is. Because let's face it we all think the worst. No matter how many people say to you not to worry they are not the specialists are they... !  I went on the 29th December for biopsy results and was pleased to be informed it was found early from a routine mammogram. Was 13mm grade 1. That was the result I wanted. Biopsy showed nothing in the lymph nodes but they have taken cancer and surrounding tissue and some lymph nodes nearest to cancer to be certain. I am 17 days post op and have appointment this Friday for more results. It's natural instinct to worry about results but seriously try not to. I made myself quite poorly through worrying but sometimes there are good results waiting. I wish you all the best for the future  Gina xx

Posts.Content: Hi all. I was diagnosed with breast cancer just before Christmas. I am 9 days post op for removal of grade 1 cancer and 2 lymph nodes. Not using deodaraunt has been hard ! I've googled what can be used and have bought from boots BOINSEN ALUMINIUM FREE ROLL ON. Just wanted to check that this will be safe to use ?

Posts.Content: Hi Valerina I'm very new to this as was diagnosed a week before Christmas. The cancer nurse told me after my op on 18 Jan no deodaraunt at all until I've had my check up appointment on 9th Feb !! Hit flushes seriously do not help smelling fresh ! I've messaged McMillan nurse and radiologist on this site so hopefully I'll get a positive answer xx  All the best to you  Gina
